result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence R. Partipilo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 14CF1277.  Credit for 6 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Karen Pohfal, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence R. Partipilo

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Hans Koesser.  Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  133 -   Sentence recommendations.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions - to run concurrently with 14CF1277. Parties stipulate to 6 days sentence credit if revoked. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court costs ordered.  No restitution requested.  Voters rights, Firearms warning, Appeal rights given.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty  Hans Koesser.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  929 - Atty Koesser is awaiting discovery and requests a new date - granted. DE provides medical proof of abscence for previous hearing to ST.  Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Hearing for DE returned.  Moved, left no address. Unable to forward. Return to Sender.
Sentencing hearing on May 12, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. DE appears by Atty Hans Koesser. DE appears by phone.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  824 - Atty Koesser reports DE has a medical issue. Adjournment requested. Court grants adjournment and requires proof of condition be brought to next hearing. Court attempted to contact DE by phone, but was unsuccessful.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hans Koesser  kmk
allowing Atty Timothy Ager II to withdraw as counsel. Successor counsel will not be appointed until the respondent goes to the SPD to be reevaluated.
to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Atty Ager
NO RECORD MADE. SEH rescheduled prior to court due to a medical issue with DE.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Attorney Tim Ager II

of Bail/Bond Forf.  kmk

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  No appearance by the Defendant.  Attorney Rocco DeFilippis appeared in court on behalf of the defendant.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:44am-  Matter heard with 14CF1277.  Attorney DeFilippis has made attempts to contact the DE but has been unsuccessful.  Based on the DE's non-appearance, Court issues a $500.00 cash bench warrant & orders $500.00 cash bond forfeited.  If the DE is return on a warrant, the Court permits the Intake Court Commissioner to modify any bond or bail conditions.
Rocco Defilippis  kmk

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:08am-  Matter heard with 14CF1277.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.

Defendant, Terrence R. Partipilo, appeared with Attorney Matthew J. Perz.  Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Atty Hinshaw called witness KPD Officer M. Hagen; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Perz. ST rested and moved for bind over; Atty Perz objected; probable cause found, bound over for trial. Information filed, reading waived. Not guily plea entered by The Court. Bond continued. Case trails 14CF1277.  Further proceedings scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 09:00 am.
